title: Canceled—Performance: Evelyn T. Wang—Layers of Vocalization
hero_caption: Evelyn Wang, 2020, in her exhibition Reflection Paper (2020), courtesy of Kunstverein für die Rheinlande und Westfalen, Düsseldorf, Germany.
short_description: Evelyn T. Wang’s lecture-performance is about layers. Layers of paint, ink, and graphite. Layers of makeup and their destiny. Layers of identities. Layers of language, one stacked on top of the other, loose and controlled, singing over speaking, listening over talking. The last layer is one made out of time—meeting painter Agnes Martin in the ruin of her semi-Zen garden to discuss how the body dissolves. Every line drawn, every color chosen.
list_description: Presented by the Society for Contemporary Art
description:
The Society for Contemporary Art regrets to inform you that this performance has been canceled due to unavoidable circumstances. The SCA will be exploring options for rescheduling this program at a later date.

Evelyn T. Wang’s lecture-performance is about layers. Layers of paint, ink, and graphite. Layers of makeup and their destiny. Layers of identities. Layers of language, one stacked on top of the other, loose and controlled, singing over speaking, listening over talking. The last layer is one made out of time—meeting painter Agnes Martin in the ruin of her semi-Zen garden to discuss how the body dissolves. Every line drawn, every color chosen.

Presented by the Society for Contemporary Art and made possible with the support of Prada

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.
